topic: HDRcapOSX October 2011 update Mac OS 10.6/10.7 and Canon EOS SDKs 2.9/2.10
body:
HDRcapOSX now works with OS X 10.6/10.7 and Canon EOS SDKs 2.9/2.10.


Denis Fan has (once again) updated HDRcapOSX. The update was compiled under 10.6.8 but seems to work under 10.7.2.  


Two versions are in the package: 


(a) Version 2.0
This version has been updated and supported under Canon EOS SDK version 2.9. The package has been compiled under Mac OS X version 10.6.8 (Snow Leopard) as an universal binary, BACKWARDS compatible up to Mac OS X version 10.4.x (Tiger). Compatible to latest camera model up to EOS 60D, NOT EOS 600D and EOS 1100D.


(b) Version 2.1
This version has been updated and supported under Canon EOS SDK version 2.10. The package has been compiled under Mac OS X version 10.6.8 (Snow Leopard) as an universal binary, BACKWARDS compatible up to Mac OS X version 10.5.x (Leopard). Compatible to latest camera model up to EOS 600D and EOS 1100D.


Testing has been limited so please report successes and failures to Denis Fan and John Mardaljevic - include camera model number in any reports.  HDRcapOSX Version 2.1 was (briefly) tested under 10.7.2 with a Canon EOS 400D and seemed to work fine.


Download here:
http://www.iesd.dmu.ac.uk/~jm/doku.php?id=resources:hdrcaposx


Best
John Mardaljevic


Reader in Daylight Modelling
Institute of Energy and Sustainable Development
De Montfort University
The Gateway, Leicester, LE1 9BH, UK
Tel: +44 (0) 116 257 7972   


jm at dmu.ac.uk
